奔.definition: to go to; to head for; towards; Taiwan pr. [ben1]

奔命.definition: to rush about on errands; to be kept on the run

奔喪.definition: to hasten home for the funeral of a parent or grandparent

奔奔族.definition: lit. Rushing Clan, generation born between 1975-1985 and China's most hedonistic and hard-working social group (netspeak)

奔忙.definition: to be busy rushing about; to bustle about

奔波.definition: to rush about; to be constantly on the move

奔流.definition: to flow at great speed; to pour; racing current

奔瀉.definition: (of torrents) to rush down; to pour down

奔現.definition: (neologism) to meet sb in real life after forming a relationship online

奔竄.definition: (of people or animals) to flee helter-skelter; to scatter; (of floodwater, an idea etc) to spread in all directions

奔襲.definition: to carry out a long-range raid

奔走.definition: to run; to rush about; to be on the go

奔赴.definition: to rush to; to hurry to

奔頭兒.definition: erhua variant of 奔頭|奔头[ben4 tou5]

奔馳.definition: to run quickly; to speed; to gallop

奔騰.definition: (of waves) to surge forward; to roll on in waves; to gallop
